title: For Many Disabled People, a Battle to Stay in Australia or New Zealand
description: The two countries are outliers in routinely rejecting potential migrants on the basis of medical needs, leaving families with one ill member to struggle in a legal limbo.
dc:creator: Natasha Frost

media:content.media:credit: David Dare Parker for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Shaffan Muhammad Ghulam at school in Willetton, Australia. He has a rare genetic condition that has made his family ineligible to remain in the country because of what his treatment would cost the health care system.
